title: Man United news: How they could drop into the Premier League relegation zone on Sunday
text:
Manchester United could drop down to 18th place if results go against them

It does not get any easier for the Red Devils as they welcome leaders Liverpool

Manchester United could drop into the relegation zone on Sunday if they lose to Liverpool and other results go against them.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side have made a dismal start to their 2019-20 league campaign with just two wins from their first eight games.

It does not get any easier for the Red Devils at the weekend as they welcome league leaders and rivals Liverpool to Old Trafford.

Manchester United could drop into the Premier League relegation zone on Sunday evening

Jurgen Klopp's side are odds-on favourites to win the clash and heap more misery on Solskjaer and his United side.

Players are unlikely to need an added incentive to try to win a derby but United can get extra motivation from the fact that they could find themselves in the bottom three by Sunday night.

If Everton, Southampton, Newcastle all win on Saturday, Brighton and Aston Villa draw and United lose by two or more goals to the Reds, United will move down to 18th place.

The Toffees take on West Ham, Southampton travel to Wolves while Newcastle face a tough trip to Frank Lampard's Chelsea side.

Ahead of Sunday's clash Solskajer believes he is still the right man for the job after executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward gave him 100 per cent backing.

'No, I've never felt it's too big for me,' said Solskjaer. 'I'm confident in what we're trying to do and with my staff, I've been so impressed. The improvement is there to see.

'We need to start winning games, start scoring goals and we need to create more chances because at the back we've looked solid.

'But we haven't been adventurous enough and taken enough risks. The best teams around take more risks and more runs in behind. Maybe the boys when they lose confidence they play safe and it's my duty to say it's not safety.'
